name: Vegan Mapo Tofu
author: MyNutriCounter
summary: When you're short on time and you're in need of something nutritious, then this quick vegan mapo tofu will certainly satisfy your taste buds. This is an authentic Sichuan-style mapo tofu, which is both spicy and aromatic.
ingredients: 3 tablespoons fermented black beans, roughly chopped
2  green onions, white parts only, chopped
1 (14 ounce) container silken tofu, cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Mix vegetable broth, maple syrup, soy sauce, and cornstarch in a bowl
Heat peanut oil in a wok over medium-high heat
Add mushrooms, black beans, green onions, garlic, ginger, and Sichuan peppercorns
Add chili bean paste and the soy sauce mixture
Cook and stir until thick, 3 to 5 minutes
Add tofu; cook until heated through, about 1 minute more
Transfer cooked tofu to a serving dish; drizzle chile oil and sesame oil on top
